definitions: a Eurasian waterside plant of the daisy family, the rounded flower heads of which are produced before the leaves. The large soft leaves were formerly used to wrap butter, and extracts of the plant have long been used medicinally as a powerful anticonvulsant.

notes.text: Genus Petasites, family Compositae: several species, in particular the common P. hybridus

shortDefinitions: Eurasian waterside plant of daisy family, rounded flower heads
